Package game

Class StunAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Action
      • game.StunAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionFactory
    public class StunAction
extends Action
implements ActionFactory
    An action and also an behaviour that throws stun powder towards the subject if subject is within 5 squares from the actor acting. The stun powder may be blocked by Ground object that blocks thrown objects and has only 50% chance of hitting the target. If the target is hit, it will be stunned for 2 rounds of the game and the actor acting will moves one space away from the actor.

        public StunAction​(Actor subject,

        Parameters:

        world - The game world all the actors are in

    • Method Detail

      • getAction

        public Action getAction​(Actor actor,
                        GameMap map)
        Returns this action (StunAction) if subject is currently stunned, or, subject not stunned but is within 5 squares of actor. Returns SkipTurnAction otherwise.
        Specified by:
        getAction in interface ActionFactory
        Parameters:
        actor - The actor performing the action
        map - The map the actor is on
        Returns:
        this action if subject is within 5 squares of actor, SkipTurnAction otherwise
        See Also:
        ActionFactory.getAction(Actor, GameMap)

      • execute

        public java.lang.String execute​(Actor actor,
                                GameMap map)
        Checks the stunStatus and acts accordingly. If stunStatus is 0, stuns subject and update stunStatus to 2 at 50% chance when there is no Ground object blocking, also moves actor away from subject. If stunStatus is 1, updates stunStatus by decrementing it and free subject from stun, also updates subject's hp. If stunStatus is 2, updates stunStatus by decrementing it.
        Specified by:
        execute in class Action
        Parameters:
        actor - The actor performing the action
        map - The map the actor is on
        Returns:
        a suitable description to display in the UI
        See Also:
        Action.execute(Actor, GameMap)
